dataset.title: PISCO: Physical Oceanography: vessel-based CTD cast data: Strawberry Hill 70m, Oregon, USA (SH70XX)

creator.organizationName: Partnership for Interdisciplinary Studies of Coastal Oceans (PISCO)

address.deliveryPoint: College of Earth, Ocean, and Atmospheric Sciences

abstract.para: This metadata record describes vessel-based CTD cast data collected at Strawberry Hill 70m, Oregon, USA, by PISCO. Measurements were collected using a Seabird Electronics SBE 25 SEACAT beginning 2015-05-18. The instrument descended to an overall water depth of 69 meters. The instrument was programmed with a sampling interval of 0.125 seconds.

keywordSet.keyword: EARTH SCIENCE: Oceans: Ocean Temperature: Water Temperature
EARTH SCIENCE: Oceans: Water Pressure: Pressure
EARTH SCIENCE: Oceans: Ocean Optics: Attenuation/Transmission
EARTH SCIENCE: Oceans: Ocean Optics: Fluorescence

intellectualRights.para: Please cite PISCO in all publications containing these data. The citation should take the form: "This study utilized data collected by the Partnership for Interdisciplinary Studies of Coastal Oceans: a long-term ecological consortium funded by the David and Lucile Packard Foundation and the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation." Please send copies of any published manuscript based on these data to the PISCO Program Coordinator (http://piscoweb.org/who/coordinators). Users of these data are encouraged to contact the Principal Investigators. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on PISCO data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original PISCO investigators.

Extensive efforts are made to ensure that online data are accurate and up to date, but the authors and PISCO will not take responsibility for any errors that may exist in data provided online. Furthermore, the user assumes all responsibility for errors in analysis or judgment resulting from use of the data.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Strawberry Hill 70m: SH70XX: The CTD downcast takes place approximately 11km offshore of the PISCO-OSU Strawberry Hill intertidal research site. This location is approximately 13.5km southwest-by-west of Yachats, Oregon, USA (heading ~241 degrees). This is also the site of the PISCO-OSU SH70 lander mooring. The downcast is conducted in approximately 70m of water below Mean Sea Level (MSL).

purpose.para: These data were collected by PISCO to understand the physical characteristics of the inner continental shelf and their potential effects on marine ecology.

description.para: Methods for PISCO CTD data collection and quality-control are available online, see the protocol citation.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: In this sampling section the altitudeMaximum tag refers to the altitude of Mean Sea Level (MSL), and altitudeMinimum tag refers to the nominal altitude of the sea floor. In other words, the altitudeMinimum represents the overall water depth, expressed as a negative altitude.

samplingDescription.para: Methods for PISCO vessel-based CTD cast data collection and quality-control are available online, see the protocol citation. Data were collected using an Seabird Electronics SBE 25 SEACAT set to one scan per 0.125 second.

project.title: Partnership for Interdisciplinary Studies of Coastal Oceans (PISCO)

abstract.para: PISCO is a large-scale marine research program that focuses on understanding the near-shore ecosystems of the U.S. West Coast. An interdisciplinary collaboration of scientists from four universities, PISCO integrates long-term monitoring of ecological and oceanographic processes at dozens of coastal sites with experimental work in the lab and field. We explore how individual organisms, populations, and ecological communities vary over space and time. Findings are applied to issues of ocean conservation and management, and are shared through our public outreach and student training programs.

funding.para: PISCO is funded by the David and Lucile Packard Foundation and the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Greenwich Mean Time calendar date of each CTD measurement record, using ISO 8601 standard format YYYY-MM-DD

Greenwich Mean Time of each CTD measurement record, to the 1/100th of a second, using ISO 8601 standard format hh:mm:ss.ssZ. The 'Z' indicates 'Zero Meridian' (or Greenwich Mean Time) and must be included.

Greenwich Mean Time of each CTD measurement record, expressed as fractional decimal days since Jan. 1 of the year measurement was made. For example, 12 noon GMT on Jan. 2 is represented by yearday 1.5, NOT yearday 2.5.
The depth to the seafloor at this station, relative to the sea surface at the time of the measurement.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this point, or it is not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The conductivity of the water, measured from the primary sensor.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Based on measured pressure and seawater density as determined from temperature and conductivity.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this point, or it is not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The percent of light emitted by a source reaching a sensor across a path of known length (usually 0.25m)

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: The value calculated from transmission accordiing to: Beam attenuation coefficient c = - ( 1 / (path length[m]) * ln ( light transmission [decimal] )

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: The estimated chlorophyll concentration from the in-situ fluorometer. Fluorescence values vary depending on a number of factors including the physiological status of phytoplankton, the types of phytoplankton present, their abundance, and other natural factors. These factors are known to result in significant diurnal variability as well as over- and under-estimation of actual chlorophyll concentrations.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Dissolved oxygen concentration as a percent of theoretical 100% saturation concentration, as output from the CTD using Seabird's factory calibration.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeLabel: Dissolved Oxygen in moles - Factory Calibration
attribute.attributeDefinition: Dissolved oxygen concentration as micromoles of oxygen per kilogram of seawater, as output from the CTD using Seabird's factory calibration.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeLabel: Dissolved Oxygen in milliliters/liter - Factory Calibration
attribute.attributeDefinition: Dissolved oxygen concentration as milliliters of oxygen per liter of sea water, as output from the CTD using Seabird's factory calibration.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Dissolved oxygen concentration as a percent of theoretical 100% saturation concentration, as corrected for sensor drift and variation by PISCO. This value is recalculated using the bottle corrected oxygen concentration and 100% saturation concentration using Seabird's formula for the Computation of Oxygen Solubility (Oxsol).

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeLabel: Dissolved Oxygen in moles - Bottle Corrected
attribute.attributeDefinition: Dissolved oxygen concentration as micromoles of oxygen per kilogram of seawater, as corrected for sensor drift and variation by PISCO. Oxygen samples are taken using the Winkler method and analyzed in the lab, and sensor data is adjusted using coefficients derived from regressing bottle data to sensor data. Exact methods may vary based on Winkler data availability over time. Bottle corrected data is considered more accurate than raw data.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeLabel: Dissolved Oxygen in milliliters/liter - Bottle Corrected
attribute.attributeDefinition: Dissolved oxygen concentration as milliliters of oxygen per liter of sea water, as corrected for sensor drift and variation by PISCO. Oxygen samples are taken using the Winkler method and analyzed in the lab, and sensor data is adjusted using coefficients derived from regressing bottle data to sensor data. Exact methods may vary based on Winkler data availability over time. Bottle corrected data is considered more accurate than raw data.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature after the effects of compression have been removed. Defined as the temperature of a parcel of water at the sea surface after it has been raised adiabatically from some depth in the ocean.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Salinity of the water, calculated according to the "Practical Salinity Scale of 1978"

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: The density anomaly calculated with in situ salinity, potential temperature and pressure=0. sigmatheta = density[kg/m3] - 1000kg/m3. (International Equation of State, Joint Panel on Oceanographic Tables and Standards, 1981)

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: The difference between the in situ specific volume (m3/kg) of a parcel and specific volume at the same pressure with S=35 and T=0[celsius].

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement was collected at this point, or it is not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: data flag used to qualify data as bad, questionable, etc.

textDomain.definition: Data for each column of the data file are flagged with a single alpha-numeric code such that the first digit holds the first data column flag, the second digit holds the second data column flag, etc. Possible flags are 0-9, A-Z, a-z; however flag definitions are currently as follows: 0 - No known bad data; 1 - Known bad data: instrument malfunction/failure, loss of memory, loss of power, bio-fouling, electronic malfunction; 2 - Suspicious data (looks bad, but no known cause); 9 - Missing data (data column has a missing value code as defined in the metadata) [0-9A-Za-z]
textDomain.source: PISCO/NMS Physical Oceanography Team accepted flagging conventions

otherEntity.entityDescription: This file is the raw, uncalibrated data file downloaded from the instrument.
This file is a list of the Seabird software processing steps used to convert the raw data file to the processed data file that this metadata file describes.
This file is the raw, uncalibrated data file downloaded from the instrument.
This file is a calibration file used by the Seabird software to convert raw voltages and frequencies to meaningful values.
